descriptions.global: - is not just a guide to the world of cooking, but a true culinary encyclopedia that invites you on an exciting journey through various gastronomic cultures. Food, as an integral part of life, in Gastro Guide is not only a physiological need, but also a social phenomenon that brings pleasure.
descriptions.local: This guide not only reveals the unique traditions of cooking in different countries, but also explores the history of dishes, noting their seasonal features. You will learn about how food customs influence the culture of each region. And this is not only a gastronomic journey, but also an in-depth study of the history and traditions of world cuisine.
descriptions.info: is created to be your guide to the world of taste and healthy nutrition. Each country page is packed with fascinating information about features, history, traditional dishes and local products. The descriptions of the dishes are enriched with detailed recipes, also with useful information about the nutritional value and composition of the ingredients. This approach makes it possible to better understand the benefits and effects of taking specific dishes on health.
descriptions.pages: In the tab devoted to health, you will find carefully reasoned aspects of both pros and againsts of the ingredients of the recipes, as well as scientific studies related to the chemical composition of food products. The presented dietary recipes take into account individual characteristics, regardless of the origin of the dish.
descriptions.user: The custom Gastro Guide functionality makes your trip even more interesting. Registration in the system allows you to participate in the discussion of recipes, save your favorite recipes in your personal profile, create your own taste portrait and receive personal recommendations from the guide. And on Gastro Guide you will find interactive step-by-step recipes for cooking dishes that allow you to learn and experience culinary art in real time.
descriptions.data: Not only the culinary side defines the Gastro Guide. In addition to recipes, you will receive valuable information about macro and micronutrients in foods, as well as the complete chemical composition of the most popular foods. You will also learn about the most interesting events in the world of cooking. And it is important to note that these data will be regularly updated to always give you new impressions and knowledge.

description.greatest: Hello there! I'm pleased to welcome you to my unique informative resource. My name is Elizabeth, I’m from Ukraine, from beautiful city Odesa.
description.education: I have two higher degrees, one in the field of food technology and the other in computer science. This website is my personal project for my master's diploma in my second field of study. I believe that both of these fields are truly important and relevant in our lives, so I decided to merge them and create an engaging informational resource. I've incorporated all of my knowledge from both directions into this application, complementing it with data from the internet and literature.
description.meaning: This application is not just a diploma or a simple project for me, because I put my heart into every word that I want to convey to society. I believe that the resource will be a real find for travelers, food enthusiasts and everyone who is interested in learning new things.
description.experience: My knowledge in the food industry is supported by both theory and practice. I tested and applied a lot of theoretical knowledge while cooking, conducted various experiments, which I took into account when collecting all the necessary information that I share with you here.

blog.part1: I also have a personal culinary blog on
blog.part2: where you can see the cooking processes of some of the dishes presented on this website. I'm always open to any suggestions and comments because it will help make the resource as useful as possible for everyone. I would like to continue to develop this project, improve the interface, add new features, fill it with new recipes, update product data, which is why I'll be glad for any feedback. I think we need to develop together.

description.gratitude: Thank you for your attention and getting to know me. I hope you will like my gastronomic guide. Enjoy your journey through the world of flavors!

terms.greatest1: Welcome to the world of cooking! I am your personal guide.
terms.greatest2: I inform you about the rules for using my capabilities. Registration on the app opens up to you:

profile.title: User profile
profile.text1: fill in your personal taste portrait and recieve a personal list of traditional dishes of the world according to your choice.
profile.text2: save your favorite recipes in your profile, which will be available to you from any device.
profile.text3: join discussions where culinary enthusiasts share experience and tips.

safety.title: Authorization, registration and security
safety.additionText: You safety is important to me. Register and take advantage of:
safety.text1: I do not need a lof of your details, just your email and name so I know how contact to you.
safety.text2: I use advanced encryption technologies to protect your confidential information.

comments.title: Commenting rules
comments.additionText: At the gastronomic guide, I strive to create a positive and friendly enviroment:
comments.text1: leave encouraging and supportive comments. Avoid profanity and insults.
comments.text2: your impressions are important. If you have comments, please express them  constructively.

categories.title: Recipes and categories
categories.additionText: Take a look at the recipies, products and countries sections, which you will find all the interesting information.
categories.text1: discover the topic of healthy eating os learn about culinary eventsin the world. I care about all my users.
categories.text2: choose recipes according to what you want to taste or how much time you have for the dish.
categories.text3: you can search by name of recipe, products or country.
categories.text4: I will help you prepare the dish with an accessible interactive step-by-step recipe that can be found on the recipe page.

feedback.title: Feedback:
feedback.additionText: Your thoughts help me become better. Please join my social media pages:
feedback.text1: Have ideas or comments? Write to my support through the feedback form in the "Contacts" block located at the bottom of every page.

violation.title: Violation
violation.additionText: I hope that you will not violate the rules of use, but I must warn you that if you violate the rules, your comments or other actions will be immediately deleted without warning, and for systematic violations you will be banned.

terms.end1: Have a nice journey through the world of flavors!

support.sendText: Thank you! Your letter has already been sent for my support service.

supportForm.email: Enter your valid email for feedback:

description.part1: Historically, our huge and rich planet Earth has been divided into different areas - continents. Each of them has its own unique features, traditions of food, growing products and breeding livestock and birds. However, there is one of the continents that is not suitable either for growing food, or for breeding livestock, or for the development of food culture in general.
description.part2: This continent is Antarctica, which is associated with permafrost. Due to the peculiarities of the geographical location and climate in Antarctica, it is impossible to enjoy the processes of cooking and creating culinary masterpieces. The main way of eating in Antarctica is the import of various canned goods and frozen semi-finished products. While other continents have a rich culinary history, unique traditions of eating and cooking. Let's consider each of them in more detail, because every corner of our beautiful world deserves attention and contributes to the culinary history of the world community.

features.first: A wide variety of cuisines in different European countries: French, Italian, Spanish, Greek, German and many others.
features.second: Use of meat: beef, pork, lamb and poultry, consumption of dairy products as an important source of protein and calcium.
features.third: Use of olives, olive oil, grapes, bread and wheat.

features.first: The use of meat such as goat, ram, crocodile, zebra and other wild animals.
features.second: The most popular dishes: couscous, jollof rice, boboti, braai (East African barbecue).
features.third: A wealth of tropical fruits and vegetables, including bananas, mangoes, papayas, ailanthus, coconuts.
features.fourth: Use lots of spices like curry and harissa.

features.first: Variety of Asian cuisine: Chinese, Indian, Japanese, Thai, Korean, Vietnamese.
features.second: The use of rice, soybeans, fish, seafood, the use of various spices: turmeric, curry, ginger, lemongrass and other traditional ingredients.
features.third: A variety of cooking techniques such as boiling, roasting, steaming and fermenting.

features.first: High consumption of meat: beef, pork and poultry, as well as seafood: lobster, shrimp and mussels.
features.second: The use of wheat for the production of bread, pasta and other bakery products.
features.third: Traditional dishes: hamburgers, hot dogs, steaks, Mexican cuisine (tacos and burritos), seafood (lobsters, mussels, shrimp).

features.first: Enriched with a variety of foods, including potatoes, corn, beans, pumpkin, meat, fish and tropical fruits.
features.second: Using traditional ingredients: quinoa, aleuros, quintales.
features.third: Traditional dishes: arroz con pollo (meat with rice), asado (steamed meat), guacamole, empanadas (stuffed pies).

features.first: Plenty of meat, including lamb, beef, kangaroo and fish from the Pacific ocean, used in Australian cuisine.
features.second: Popular dishes: barbecue, lamb chops, kangaroo burgers, seafood.
features.third: Eating many tropical fruits that grow in this region.

title.part1: Cuisine and traditions of the continent

SouthAmerica.countriesTitle: Countries of the South American continent

featuresList.parag: South America is known for its diverse and unique food, and some dishes from this continent are gaining great popularity in world cuisine. I suggest you familiarize yourself with some features and interesting facts about food on this continent:

point1.text: The cuisine of Peru is considered one of the most diverse in South America and one of the best in the world. Peru's culinary heritage has a refined and diverse cuisine that combines Native American, Spanish and African influences. Peruvian food culture is known for dishes such as "ceviche" (raw seafood with lemon juice and spices), "lomo saltado" (grilled pork with vegetables and spices), "quei" (quinoa cheese) and "anticucho" (grilled marinated meat).
point1.alt: Ceviche is a dish of Peruvian cuisine

point2.text: Argentina is famous for its "asado" - a traditional barbecue with beef, lamb and pork. This special meat dish is cooked over an open fire and is one of the main parts of Argentine culture and family gatherings. Also popular are "empanadas" (stuffed pies), "milanesa" (breaded meat), "mate" (Paraguayan tea) and "dulce de leche" (milk pastry cream). Food is a way to bring family and friends together, and Argentines value table time and hospitality.
point2.alt: Asado is a dish of Argentine cuisine.

point3.text: Brazil is known for its abundance of exotic fruits such as acai, passion fruit, guava and mango. Brazilian cuisine includes such popular dishes as "feijoada" (bean soup with meat) and "pao de queueu" (cheese balls). In Brazil, there is a tradition of morning breakfast called "cafe-com-light". It is a rich breakfast that usually includes fresh fruit, bread, cookies, cakes and juices. And on the walk you can find acaraje - this is a popular street food in Brazil, especially in the state of Bahia. These are fried corn balls with shrimp, served with spicy sauces.

point4.text: Chile is the largest consumer of seafood in South America. Salmon, eel, mussels, scallops, oysters and shrimp are just some of the most popular types of seafood found in Chilean cuisine. Chile is famous for its production of high-quality wine. Vineyards in Chile produce a variety of wines, including Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, and Chardonnay. In Chile, in addition to its exquisite wines, there is a popular dish called "pastel de choclo", which is a baked puff pastry with meat, eggs, olives and corn filling.
point4.alt: Seafood, fish, shrimp, lobster, lobster, octopus

point5.text: In Venezuela, the "arepa" is a popular street food, which is a flat corn bread fried and filled with various fillings such as meat, cheese or beans. Venezuela produces and consumes more bananas than any other country in South America. Bananas are often used in a variety of dishes, including banana bread and desserts. "Pabellon criollo" is a traditional national dish of Venezuela. It consists of cotton rice, black beans, roast beef or pork and plantain.
point5.alt: Arepa is a Venezuelan dish. Corn bread.

point6.text: The Amazon rainforest offers a variety of exotic foods: acai, dragon fruit, guava, passion fruit, guanabana and mangosteen. These fruits have unique flavors and nutritional properties, and are used in many dishes and drinks. The Amazon forest is one of the main places where Brazil nuts are grown, a rich source of healthy fats and proteins. The Amazon is known for growing quality cocoa, and many types of cocoa beans come from this region. The Amazon is known for its superfoods such as acai, maca, chia. Which have a high nutritional value and are a source of vitamins and antioxidants.
point6.alt: Exotic fruits, dragon, dragon fruit, mango, papaya, melon, grapefruit

featuresProductsList.parag: South America is rich in variety of products due to its climate and geographical diversity. Here you can find various fruits, vegetables, seafood and meat:

point1.text: Potatoes were one of the main food products of the Incas and other ancient civilizations in the Andes, in the region of modern southern Peru and the extreme northwestern region of Bolivia. It was brought to Europe after the discovery of America and became one of the key cultivated plants around the world.
point1.alt: Potatoes are the most popular vegetable in the world

point2.text: Chili, or pepper, originates from South America and has been important in local cuisines for centuries. Different varieties of chilies are used to prepare sauces, spices and add spiciness to dishes.
point2.alt: Chili pepper is a traditional product of the countries of South America, Chile, Argentina, Bolivia, Peru.

point3.text: Alkagan, or amaranth, is also one of the ancient cultural crops of South America. Amaranth seeds contain a lot of protein and are the basis for preparing various dishes and bakery products.
point3.alt: Amaranth is a plant that has its roots in South America.

point4.text: Quinoa is a pseudo-grain that originates from the Andes of South America. Quinoa is a rich source of protein, carbohydrates, vitamins and minerals. The absence of gluten and the content of the essential amino acid "lysine" make this product convenient and useful for people with a gluten allergy and a limited diet.
point4.alt: Quinoa seeds are a gluten-free product

point5.text: Chocolate: Cocoa, from which chocolate is made, has its origins in South America. Historically, the Maya and Aztecs used cacao in their culture and religious ceremonies. Chocolate continues to be an important product in the region and is exported around the world.

title.part1: Cuisine and traditions of the continent

NorthAmerica.countriesTitle: Countries of the North American continent

featuresList.parag: The diversity of the food culture of North America is connected not only with the history and national characteristics of the continent, but also with a large number of migrants from all over the world, who brought the diversity of food traditions to all countries of the continent.

point1.text: North America is known for its love of fast food. Hot dogs and hamburgers are symbols of American culture. A large number of famous international fast food chains, such as McDonald's and Burger King, have their roots here. This passion for fast food has had a significant impact on the food culture of the region, reflecting consumer habits and contemporary trends. From here, fast food grew into a global phenomenon, offering the tastes of America in every corner of the planet and becoming an integral part of the world's culinary heritage.
point1.alt: Fast food is an American popular food

point2.text: BBQ is an important part of the food culture in North America, especially in the Southern states. This culinary tradition is a real passion for many Americans, and various styles of barbecue are known, such as Texas with large cuts of meat, Carolina with a special sauce and Memphis with pork. This tradition not only unites families and friends during gastronomic events, but also reflects the versatility of American taste and the ability to perfect recipes over the generations.
point2.alt: Barbecue - culinary traditions of America and Canada

point3.text: North America is also famous for its authentic Mexican cuisine, which is one of the most popular cuisines on the continent. Mexican cuisine impresses with its variety and use of characteristic ingredients, such as tasty avocados, aromatic chilies, juicy tomatoes, traditional corn, and white lentils. Dishes such as traditional tacos, mouth-watering fajitas, juicy guacamole and spicy salsa impress with their taste and roots in Mexican culture, giving them popularity and a special place in the culinary manifestation of the region.
point3.alt: Mexican tacos are a traditional dish of Mexico

point4.text: North America is famous for its diversity in food, and the continent often hosts a variety of multinational food festivals dedicated to different cuisines and traditions. These festivals provide a great opportunity to taste a variety of foods and enjoy cultural diversity through the presence of food. Thanks to this, you can find restaurants and cafes on the continent that offer cuisines from all over the world. From delicious Italian pizzas to exquisite French dishes, from fragrant Asian cuisine to the indigenous flavors of African dishes, you have the opportunity to enjoy the authentic tastes of different cultures.

point5.text: North America is famous for the popularity of carbonated beverages such as cola and lemonade, as well as a variety of non-alcoholic beverages such as coffee and tea. In particular, the continent is home to a burgeoning craft brewing industry, particularly in the US and Canada, where a large number of independent breweries operate. These breweries offer a wide range of different beers, including exotic and experimental options, reflecting the versatility of flavors and an innovative approach to brewing.

point6.text: In the United States and Canada, breakfast is considered an extremely important meal and is given special attention and importance. It traditionally serves dishes that include scrambled eggs, bacon, cereal, toast, and donuts. Another characteristic feature is the portion sizes in North American restaurants, which often impress with their gigantic portions. This reflects the tradition of "bigger and better". So, when visiting such establishments, be prepared to share dishes with mutual friends or ask to pack leftovers for later consumption.
point6.alt: An important traditional breakfast of North America, the USA, and Canada.

featuresProductsList.parag: The region has a rich heritage and a variety of foods that have had a significant impact on culinary traditions both within and outside the continent.

point1.text: The pumpkin originated and was cultivated for thousands of years in the territory of North America, it is an important part of the history of this region. It has a special significance in the culture and traditions of Native American tribes, who used the pumpkin not only as food, but also for various religious and ritual purposes. Today, the pumpkin is widely used in North American cooking, where it has become not only a main ingredient in popular dishes such as pumpkin pie and pumpkin soup, but also a symbol of the fall holiday season, such as Thanksgiving and Halloween.
point1.alt: Pumpkin is a popular Halloween decoration and a delicious fruit that grows on American soil.

point2.text: Different varieties of beans, such as black beans, red beans, and Navajo beans, also have deep roots in North American history. Beans were not only a staple food source for Native American tribes, but also played an important role in cooking, adding many flavors to Mexican and South American cuisine. The purposeful use of the bean in various dishes has given it cultural significance and highlighted its importance in the food heritage of the continent.
point2.alt: Different varieties of beans that grow in North America.

point3.text: Cranberry, also known as bog cranberry, is a plant with a long history in North America. It has deep roots in use by Native American tribes, who have been finding ways to use this plant in food, medicine, and ritual for centuries. Today, cranberries are widely used in cooking, adding their unique flavor properties to a variety of dishes, including sauces, drinks, and desserts.
point3.alt: Cranberry (cranberry) - traditional berries in North America.

point4.text: Corn (maize) has its roots in Mexico and Central America, where it has been cultivated for thousands of years. Over time, corn became one of the most important foods in North America, and its use spread in various forms, such as whole grains, cornmeal, and cornflakes, which gained popularity for their taste and versatility in cooking.
point4.alt: Corn is a root plant of the North American continent

title.part1: Cuisine and traditions of the continent
Cuisine and traditions of the continent
Cuisine and traditions of the continent

featuresList.parag: European gastronomy is a taste mark in history and traditions. European cuisine is a place where taste and history are intertwined, and the aromas of dishes carry centuries-old traditions. Each region of the continent brings to the world of gastronomy something unique, deeply rooted in culture and way of life. European cuisine is not just food. It embodies the history, traditions and specifics of each region, making the taste trail a great revelation for everyone who touches the European table.

point1.text: Culinary map: regional differences and identity. Europe is a mosaic of various cultures and traditions. Each region has its own unique culinary identity. Mediterranean cuisine, rich in olive oil and fresh herbs, differs from the delicious sausages and cheeses of Central Europe. And these are just a few examples from an incredible variety of dishes and ingredients.
point1.alt: Bruschettas with different contents, indicating the diversity of the food culture of the regions of the continent.

point2.text: Seasonality and simplicity: Europeans prefer seasonal and fresh products. Salads, baked vegetables, fruit desserts - all this becomes part of the tables depending on the season. Ease of preparation and the use of the best ingredients emphasize natural taste harmony.
point2.alt: Fresh products: vegetables, fruits, cheese, dairy products, eggs.

point3.text: Rituals and communal tables united within the heart. Food culture in Europe is defined by family dinners and shared dinners with friends. Here, cooking and consuming food is a real ritual. From long lunches in the Mediterranean to festive dinners in Eastern Europe, food brings people together.

point4.text: Winemaking and brewing - the art of drinks. Wine and beer in Europe are not just drinks, but works of art. Vineyards of Provence, wine cellars of Tuscany, breweries of Belgium - each region has its own traditions and secrets of production, which are passed down from generation to generation.
point4.alt: Winemaking is a traditional European production.

point5.text: Gastronomic creativity from tradition to innovation. European cuisine is a combination of ancient traditions and bold innovations. Chefs introduce new cooking techniques and experiment with flavors, creating author's masterpieces. While preserving the taste touch of the past, they open new perspectives of modern gastronomy.

featuresProductsList.parag: Europe is the historical place of origin of many products. The most popular of them:

point1.text: Olives originate from the Mediterranean region of Europe, especially Spain, Italy and Greece. Olives are grown for the production of olive oil. It is an integral part of local cuisine, used as an appetizer, antipasto and as an ingredient in many dishes.
point1.alt: Olives - oil and traditions of the Mediterranean.

point2.text: Grapes are spread all over the world, in particular, they have roots in Italy, Spain and France. Grapes are used to make wine, which has become not only a drink but also a part of culture and ritual in Europe. Known for the wealth of varieties and wine regions.
point2.alt: Grapes are a traditional product of European countries.

point3.text: Tomato is a product of southern Europe. Tomatoes have become an integral part of European cuisine, in particular, in Italian sauces and salads. They gained popularity due to their juiciness and rich taste. Most dishes of European cuisine contain tomatoes.
point3.alt: Tomatoes are juicy and irreplaceable in the European cultural heritage.

point4.text: Cheeses are the main cultural culinary heritage of all of Europe. Cheesemaking became one of the most important industries in ancient Europe. There are many varieties of cheese, such as Parmesan, Gouda, Dor Bleu, Maasdam, Radomer, Mozzarella, Feta and others.
point4.alt: Cheese making is an ancient European tradition.

point5.text: Bacon - a salted, smoked piece of pork breast or belly. It is spread all over the world, but it has its roots in Europe. Germany and Spain are famous for the production of high-quality bacon. Bacon is used in a variety of dishes, from breakfasts to soups and salads, and gives them a characteristic aroma and taste.
point5.alt: Bacon - a salted, smoked piece of pork breast or belly.

title.part1: Cuisine and traditions of the continent

CountryPage.historyTitle: History of the origin of cooking in the country

nutritionalValues.attention: *Attention! It is important to remember! All proteins, fats, carbohydrates and caloric content calculations vary depending on the quality of the ingredients, the cooking process and other factors. This means that all calculations can be as close as possible to real ones, but cannot be 100% accurate.

stepsRecipe.helpTitle: I can help you with cooking

one.title: How to work with it?
one.text: I can help you prepare a dish with a step-by-step recipe that is presented in the form of cards. Each card corresponds to a cooking step.

two.title: How to start?
two.text: To start, you need to press the Start cooking button. Then read the cooking instructions and follow them step by step.

three.title: Note block.
three.text: I'm trying to help you with the hints you'll find in the Note block.

four.title: Can the ingredients be substituted?
four.text: Also, I understand that we all have different tastes, so where possible I provide you with a list of ingredient substitutes, which can be found in the Substitutions section.

five.title: Media help.
five.text: I have presented you with pictures for a better understanding of the processes. Be careful, not all photos correspond to the actual recipe, but all photos correspond to the required process. I will eventually replace all the photos with real ones when the photos are ready.

form.title: A tasteful portrait!
form.description: Let's create your personal taste profile so I can recommend dishes based on your personal preferences. Answer the next few questions based solely on your personal tastes or what you would like to see on your personal profile.

firstQ.question: Which world cuisines give you the most pleasure and/or interest?

options.northernEuropean: Northern European (Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Finland, etc.)
options.latinAmerican: Latin American (Caribbean, Mexico, Costa Rica, etc.)

secondQ.question: Choose the categories of dishes that you would like to see in your personal selection.

thirdQ.question: Choose the cooking methods you want to see.

fourthQ.question: Choose products to which you are allergic or have other contraindications, or you simply do not want to see them in recipes for other reasons?
